The Great Lakes contain 22% of the world's total fresh water: 22,810 km3 or 2.3×1016 litres.
इतना आयतन संराअमेरिका के ४८ संसक्त राज्यों को समान रूप से ९.५ फीट पानी में डुबाने के लिए पर्याप्त है।
This volume is enough to submerge the 48 United States of America in 9.5 feet of water evenly.
 तथापि, इस आयतन का केवल २% ही प्रतिवर्ष प्रतिस्थापित होता है, जिसके कारण हाल के वर्षों में मानव उपयोग के चलते जल-स्तर में गिरावट आई है। 
However, only 2% of this volume is replaced annually, leading to a decline in water levels in recent years due to human use.

Although these lakes contain a large percentage of the world's fresh water, they provide only a small portion of North America's potable water (roughly 4.2%).

title: Great Lakes
translation3: The Great Lakes contain 22% of the world's total fresh water: 22,810 km3 or 2.3×1016 litres. This volume is enough to evenly submerge the 48 contiguous states of the United States in 9.5 feet of water. However, only 2% of this volume is replaced annually, leading to a decline in water levels in recent years due to human use. Although these lakes contain a large percentage of the world's fresh water, they provide only a small portion of North America's potable water (roughly 4.2%).

text: Prince Hamlet of Denmark is the son of the recently deceased King Hamlet, and nephew of King Claudius, his father's brother and successor. Claudius hastily married King Hamlet's widow, Gertrude, Hamlet's mother, and took the throne for himself. Denmark has a long-standing feud with neighbouring Norway, in which King Hamlet slew King Fortinbras of Norway in a battle some years ago. Although Denmark defeated Norway and the Norwegian throne fell to King Fortinbras's infirm brother, Denmark fears that an invasion led by the dead Norwegian king's son, Prince Fortinbras, is imminent.
premise: डेनमार्क के राजा हैमलेट की हत्या करता है। उसके इस षडयंत्र में मृत राजा की पत्नी गरट्रूड भी उसका साथ देती हैI वो दोनों ये अफवाह फैला देते हैं कि राजा हैमलेट की मौत सांप के काटने से हुई है I राजा की मृत्यु के कुछ दिन बाद ही गरट्रूड क्लॉडियस से शादी कर लेती है। इस प्रकार अब क्लॉडियस डेनमार्क का नया राजा बन जाता है I

annotations.comment:
डेनमार्क के राजा हैमलेट की हत्या करता है। 
Kills Hamlet, King of Denmark. 
उसके इस षडयंत्र में मृत राजा की पत्नी गरट्रूड भी उसका साथ देती हैI
The dead king's wife Gertrude also supports him in this conspiracy.
वो दोनों ये अफवाह फैला देते हैं कि राजा हैमलेट की मौत सांप के काटने से हुई है I
Both of them spread the rumor that King Hamlet died due to a snake bite. 
राजा की मृत्यु के कुछ दिन बाद ही गरट्रूड क्लॉडियस से शादी कर लेती है। 
Only a few days after the king's death, Gertrude marries Claudius.
 इस प्रकार अब क्लॉडियस डेनमार्क का नया राजा बन जाता है I
Thus Claudius now becomes the new king of Denmark.

title: Hamlet
translation3: The King of Denmark murders Hamlet. Gertrude, the dead king's wife, also joins him in his conspiracy. Both of them spread the rumor that King Hamlet died due to snake bite. Gertrude marries Claudius just a few days after the king's death. So Claudius now becomes the new king of Denmark.

text: Racial discrimination and inequality against blacks in South Africa dates to the beginning of large-scale European colonization of South Africa with the Dutch East India Company's establishment of a trading post in the Cape of Good Hope in 1652, which eventually expanded into the Dutch Cape Colony. The company began the Khoikhoi–Dutch Wars in which it displaced the local Khoikhoi people, replaced them with farms worked by white settlers, and imported black slaves from across the Dutch Empire. In the days of slavery, slaves required passes to travel away from their masters.
premise: दक्षिण अफ़्रीका के संदर्भ में नस्ली भेदभाव का इतिहास बहुत पुराना है। इसकी शुरुआत डच उपनिवेशवादियों द्वारा कैप टाउन को अपने रिफ्रेशमेंट स्टेशन के रूप में स्थापित करने से मानी जाती है। एशिया में उपनिवेश कायम करने के लिए डच उपनिवेशवादी इसी रास्ते से जाते थे। इसी दौरान इस क्षेत्र की अफ़्रीकी आबादी के बीच रहने वाले युरोपियनों ने ख़ुद को काले अफ़्रीकियों के हुक्मरानों की तरह देखना शुरू किया। शासकों और शासितों के बीच श्रेष्ठता और निम्नता का भेद करने के लिए कालों को युरोपियनों से हाथ भर दूर रखने का आग्रह पनपना ज़रूरी था। परिस्थिति का विरोधाभास यह था कि गोरे युरोपियन मालिकों के जीवन में कालों की अंतरंग उपस्थिति भी थी। इसी अंतरंगता के परिणामस्वरूप एक मिली-जुली नस्ल की रचना हुई जो ‘अश्वेत’ कहलाए।
title: Apartheid
translation3: Racial discrimination has a long history in the South African context. It traces its origin to the Dutch colonists establishing Cape Town as their refreshment station. Dutch colonialists used this route to establish colonies in Asia. During this time, Europeans living among the region's African population began to see themselves as rulers of black Africans. To distinguish between superiority and inferiority between the rulers and the ruled, it was necessary to develop the urge to keep the blacks at arm's length from the Europeans. The paradox of the situation was that blacks also had an intimate presence in the lives of the white European owners. As a result of this intimacy, a mixed race was created which would be called 'black'.

text: Akon confirmed in an August 2007 interview with the Polish website INTERIA. PL that he worked on a movie called "Cocaine Cowboys", which tells the story of Jon Roberts, the main pilot of the Medellín Cartel.
premise: एकॉन ने अगस्त 2007 में पोलिश वेबसाईट INTERIA.PL को दिए गए एक साक्षात्कार में इस तथ्य की पुष्टि की हैं कि वे "कोकेन काउब्वायज" नाम की एक फिल्म पर काम कर रहें हैं जो मेडेलिन कारटेल (कोलम्बिया में मादक द्रव्यों के अवैध व्यापारी) के प्रधान परिचालक जॉन रॉबर्ट्स की कथा पर आधारित है।
title: Akon
translation3: Akon confirmed in an August 2007 interview with the Polish website INTERIA.PL that he was working on a film titled "Cocaine Cowboys", based on the Medellin Cartel. Based on the story by Principal Conductor John Roberts.

text: Presented at the April 2003 New York International Auto Show, for the 2004 US model year, the NHW20 Prius was a complete redesign. It became a compact liftback, sized between the Corolla and the Camry, with redistributed mechanical and interior space significantly increasing rear-seat legroom and luggage room. The second-generation Prius is more environmentally friendly than the previous model (according to the EPA), and is longer than the previous version. . Its more aerodynamic Kammback body balances length and wind resistance, resulting in a . The development effort, led by chief engineer Shigeyuki Hori, led to 530 patents for the vehicle.

text: The letters c, q, w, x and z are only used in loanwords. As loanwords are assimilated into Norwegian, their spelling might change to reflect Norwegian pronunciation and the principles of Norwegian orthography, e.g. zebra in Norwegian is written . Due to historical reasons, some otherwise Norwegian family names are also written using these letters.
premise: अक्षर c, q, w, x और z सिर्फ विदेशी भाषा के शब्दों में प्रयुक्त होते हैं। चूंकि विदेशी भाषा के शब्द नॉर्वेइआई भाषा (नोर्स्क) में जुड चुके हैं इसलिये उनकी वर्तनी मौलिक ना होकर नॉर्वेइआई उच्चारण व वर्तनी के सिद्धाँतों के हिसाब से बदल सकती है। जैसे की अंग्रेजी भाषा का शब्द zebra नॉर्वेइआई भाषा में sebra (शेब्रा) लिखा जाता है। ऐतिहासिक कारणों से कुछ नॉर्वेइआई परिवार भी अपने खानदानी नामों में इन अक्षरों का प्रयोग करते हैं।

annotations.comment: (didn't find any differences).

अक्षर c, q, w, x और z सिर्फ विदेशी भाषा के शब्दों में प्रयुक्त होते हैं।
The letters c, q, w, x and z are only used in loanwords. 

चूंकि विदेशी भाषा के शब्द नॉर्वेइआई भाषा (नोर्स्क) में जुड चुके हैं इसलिये उनकी वर्तनी मौलिक ना होकर नॉर्वेइआई उच्चारण व वर्तनी के सिद्धाँतों के हिसाब से बदल सकती है। 
As loanwords are assimilated into Norwegian, their spelling might change to reflect Norwegian pronunciation and the principles of Norwegian orthography.

जैसे की अंग्रेजी भाषा का शब्द zebra नॉर्वेइआई भाषा में sebra (शेब्रा) लिखा जाता है। 
E.g. English word zebra is written as sebra in Norwegian. 

 ऐतिहासिक कारणों से कुछ नॉर्वेइआई परिवार भी अपने खानदानी नामों में इन अक्षरों का प्रयोग करते हैं।
Due to historical reasons, some Norwegian families also use these alphabets in their surnames.

title: Norwegian language
translation3: The letters c, q, w, x and z are used only in foreign language words. Since words from foreign languages ​​have been added to the Norwegian language (Norsk), their spelling is not original but may change according to the principles of Norwegian pronunciation and spelling. For example, the English word zebra is written as sebra in Norwegian. For historical reasons, some Norwegian families also use these letters in their family names.

text: The Shiva Purana says that Ganesha had begotten two sons: (safety) and (profit). In northern Indian variants of this story, the sons are often said to be (auspiciousness) and . . The 1975 Hindi film Jai Santoshi Maa shows Ganesha married to Riddhi and Siddhi and having a daughter named Santoshi Ma, the goddess of satisfaction. This story has no Puranic basis, but Anita Raina Thapan and Lawrence Cohen cite Santoshi Ma's cult as evidence of Ganesha's continuing evolution as a popular deity.

text: Agnostic views are as old as philosophical skepticism, but the terms agnostic and agnosticism were created by Huxley (1825–1895) to sum up his thoughts on contemporary developments of metaphysics about the "unconditioned" (William Hamilton) and the "unknowable" (Herbert Spencer). text: Most varieties go dormant in the fall, with reduced growth in response to low temperatures and shorter days. 'Nondormant' varieties that grow through the winter are planted in long-season environments such as Mexico, Arizona, and Southern California, whereas 'dormant' varieties are planted in the Upper Midwest, Canada, and the Northeast. 'Nondormant' varieties can be higher-yielding, but they are susceptible to winter-kill in cold climates and have poorer persistence.

text: A judo technique starts with gripping the opponent, followed by off-balancing them and using their momentum against them, and then applying the technique. Kuzushi (the art of breaking balance) is also used in jujutsu, whereby an opponent's attack is deflected using their momentum against them in order to arrest their movements then throw them or pin them with a technique — thus controlling the opponent. It is known in both systems that kuzushi is essential in order to use as little energy as possible. Jujutsu differs from judo in a number of ways. In some circumstances, judoka generate kuzushi by striking one's opponent along his weak line. Other methods of generating kuzushi include grabbing, twisting, poking or striking areas of the body known as atemi points or pressure points (areas of the body where nerves are close to the skin – see kyusho-jitsu) to unbalance opponent and set up throws.
premise: जू-जुत्सु में कुशलता प्राप्त करने के लिये वर्षों परिश्रम करना पड़ता है। सीखने वालों को आदमी की शारीरिक बनावट खूब अच्छी तरह समझाई जाती है, उसे विशेषतया बताया जाता है कि आदमी की तंत्रिकाएँ (nerves) किस किस जगह सबसे अधिक अरक्षित होती है जहाँ चोट लगने से बिजली का सा धक्का लगता है और कुछ देर के लिये आदमी शक्तिहीन हो जाता है; जैसे केहुनी के पीछे की नस या पेट के ऊपरी भाग 'सौर चक्र' (solar plexus) चोट लगने से कुछ समय के लिये साँस बंद हो जाती है और मनुष्य किसी काम का नहीं रह जाता। यह भी बताया जाता है कि कौन जोड़ कमजोर है या हाथ और पैर को कैसे मोड़ा जाय कि वे उतर जायँ या टूट जायँ। जू-जुत्सू जाननेवाला कभी हमला करनेवाले के झोंक को नहीं रोकता बल्कि उसको आने देता है और अचानक आक्रमणकारी को ऐसे मोड़ देता है कि उसकी शक्ति उसी के विरुद्ध चली जाती है। अपने ऊपर झपटनेवाले को वह रोकेगा नहीं, बल्कि उसको और धक्का देकर ऐसा टेढ़ा गिराएगा कि उसका हाथ उतर जाय या गरदन में मोच आ जाय।
title: Jujutsu
translation3: One has to work hard for years to become proficient in Ju-Jutsu. The physical structure of man is explained very well to the learners, they are especially told which places of man's nerves are most unprotected, where an injury feels like an electric shock and the man is paralyzed for some time. becomes powerless; For example, due to injury to the vein behind the elbow or the upper part of the stomach, the 'solar plexus', breathing stops for some time and the person becomes useless. It is also told which joint is weak or how to bend the arms and legs to prevent them from coming off or breaking. A person who knows ju-jutsu never stops the attacker's blow but allows it to come and suddenly turns the attacker in such a way that his power goes against him. He will not stop the person who attacks him, but will push him further and make him fall in such a way that his hand gets dislocated or his neck gets sprained.

text: Jonson's father lost his property, was imprisoned, and, as a Protestant, suffered forfeiture under Queen Mary. Becoming a clergyman upon his release, he died a month before his son's birth. His widow married a master bricklayer two years later. Jonson attended school in St Martin's Lane in London. Later, a family friend paid for his studies at Westminster School, where the antiquarian, historian, topographer and officer of arms William Camden (1551–1623) was one of his masters. The pupil and master became friends, and the intellectual influence of Camden's broad-ranging scholarship upon Jonson's art and literary style remained notable, until Camden's death in 1623.

In 1606 AD, he had to suffer imprisonment for a few days for writing a satirical play called 'Eastward'.
१६१६ ई. में महाराजा जेम्स प्रथम ने उनके लिये पेंशन निर्धारित की तथा सन् १६१८ में उन्होंने स्काटलैंड की यात्रा की जहाँ उनकी भेंट ड्रमंड ऑव हाथांडैन से हुई जिन्होंने उनके साथ हुए वार्तालाप को लिपिबद्ध किया।
In 1616, King James I fixed a pension for him, and in 1618 he traveled to Scotland, where he met Drummond of Hathandain, who recorded his conversation with him.
 सन् १६२८ में बेन जॉन्सन क्रोनोलाजर ऑव लंदन के पद पर नियुक्त हुए।
In 1628, Ben Johnson was appointed to the post of Chronolazar of London.
 अपने गंभीर अध्ययन एवं सुदृढ़ व्यक्तित्व के कारण वे सम्मानित हुए तथा अपने युग के सभी प्रमुख साहित्यकारों से या तो उनकी मैत्री थी अथवा विरोध था।
Due to his serious studies and strong personality, he was respected and he was either friendly or opposed to all the major writers of his era.

title: Ben Jonson
translation3: He was a favorite disciple of the famous teacher William Camden. Before 1597, in addition to helping his father in his business, he resided in Flanders for several years for military service. In the same year he started writing plays. In 1568 AD, he killed a colleague in a duel but escaped the death penalty because he was a religious preacher. At this time he accepted Roman Catholicism, which he later abandoned. In 1606 AD, he had to undergo imprisonment for a few days for writing a satirical play named 'Eastward'. In 1616 AD, King James I fixed a pension for him and in 1618 he traveled to Scotland where he met Drummond of Hathandain who recorded the conversation with him. In 1628, Ben Johnson was appointed to the post of Chronologist of London. Due to his serious studies and strong personality, he was respected and he was either friendly or opposed to all the major litterateurs of his era.

text: By convention, an astronaut employed by the Russian Federal Space Agency (or its Soviet predecessor) is called a cosmonaut in English texts. The word is an Anglicization of kosmonavt ( ). Other countries of the former Eastern Bloc use variations of the Russian kosmonavt, such as the (although Polish also uses , and the two words are considered synonyms).

text: Quranic verses describe Adam was being expelled from al-Jannah, "the garden", which is the commonly used word for paradise in Islam. However, according to Ibn Kathir (d. 1372) and Ar-Razi (d. 1209), (exegetes of the Quran), four interpretations of the location of the garden prevailed among early Muslims:

text: Almonds were one of the earliest domesticated fruit trees, due to "the ability of the grower to raise attractive almonds from seed. Thus, in spite of the fact that this plant does not lend itself to propagation from suckers or from cuttings, it could have been domesticated even before the introduction of grafting". Domesticated almonds appear in the Early Bronze Age (3000–2000 BC), such as the archaeological sites of Numeira (Jordan), or possibly earlier. Another well-known archaeological example of the almond is the fruit found in Tutankhamun's tomb in Egypt (c. 1325 BC), probably imported from the Levant. An article on almond tree cultivation in Spain is brought down in Ibn al-'Awwam's 12th-century agricultural work, Book on Agriculture.

text: Samsung Galaxy devices use the Android operating system produced by Google, with a custom user interface called One UI (with previous versions being known as Samsung Experience and TouchWiz). However, the Galaxy TabPro S is the first Galaxy-branded Windows 10 device that was announced in CES 2016. The Galaxy Watch is the first Galaxy-branded smartwatch since the release of later iterations of the Gear smartwatch from 2014 to 2017.
premise: सैमसंग गैलेक्सी डिवाइस गुगल द्वारा निर्मित एंड्रॉइड ऑपरेटिंग सिस्टम का उपयोग करते हैं, आमतौर पर वन यूआई नामक एक कस्टम उपयोगकर्ता इंटरफ़ेस के साथ (पिछले संस्करणों को सैमसंग अनुभव और टचविज़ के रूप में जाना जाता है)। हालाँकि, गैलेक्सी टैबप्रो एस पहला गैलेक्सी-ब्रांडेड विंडोज 10 डिवाइस है जिसे सीईएस 2016 में घोषित किया गया था। गैलेक्सी वॉच 2014 से 2017 तक गियर स्मार्टवॉच के बाद के पुनरावृत्तियों को जारी करने के बाद गैलेक्सी-ब्रांडेड स्मार्टवॉच है। अप्रैल 2019 में, कंपनी ने घोषणा की कि वह अपने फोल्डिंग स्मार्टफोन, सैमसंग गैलेक्सी फोल्ड की रिलीज़ को स्थगित कर देगी, कई दिनों बाद कई शुरुआती समीक्षकों ने कहा कि उनके उपकरणों की स्क्रीन टूट गई थी; फॉल्ड को सितंबर 2019 में फिर से बनाया गया।
title: Samsung Galaxy
translation3: Samsung Galaxy devices use the Android operating system manufactured by Google, usually with a custom user interface called One UI (previous versions are known as Samsung Experience and TouchWiz). However, the Galaxy TabPro S is the first Galaxy-branded Windows 10 device that was announced at CES 2016. The Galaxy Watch is a Galaxy-branded smartwatch, following the release of subsequent iterations of the Gear smartwatch from 2014 to 2017. In April 2019, the company announced it would postpone the release of its folding smartphone, the Samsung Galaxy Fold, several days after several early reviewers said their devices' screens were cracked; The fault was rebuilt in September 2019.

text: Oliver Cromwell (25 April 15993 September 1658) was a politician and soldier, widely regarded as one of the most important statesmen in English history. He came to prominence during the 1639 to 1653 Wars of the Three Kingdoms, first as a senior commander in the Parliamentarian army and then as a politician. A leading advocate of the execution of Charles I in January 1649, which led to the establishment of The Protectorate, he ruled as Lord Protector from December 1653 until his death in September 1658. Cromwell nevertheless remains a controversial figure in both Britain and Ireland, due to his use of the military to first acquire, then retain political power, and the brutality of his 1649 Irish campaign.
premise: ऑलिवर क्रॉमवेल (25 अप्रैल 1599- 3 सितम्बर 1658) अंग्रेजी जनरल और राजनेता थे, जो पहले एक अधीनस्थ के रूप में और बाद में कमांडर-इन-चीफ के रूप में, इंग्लैंड के गृहयुद्ध के दौरान राजा चार्ल्स प्रथम के खिलाफ इंग्लैंड की संसद की सेनाओं का नेतृत्व किया। बाद में 1653 से 1658 में अपनी मृत्यु तक ब्रिटिश द्वीपों को 'लॉर्ड प्रोटेक्टर' के रूप में शासन किया। उन्होंने राज्य के प्रमुख और नए गणतंत्र की सरकार के प्रमुख के रूप में एक साथ कार्य किया।

text: Originally, these vehicles were simply called the 'Land Rover' – an off-road capable car model of the Rover Company. As 'Land Rover' became established as a brand, the 'Series' indication later became a retronym model name. The Range Rover was introduced in 1970, and the company became a British Leyland subsidiary in 1978. In 1983 and 1984, the long and the short wheelbase Land Rovers were finally given official names – the One Ten, and the Ninety respectively, and together they were badged the Defender models in 1990, after the 1989 introduction of the new Discovery model.

text: Attempts to produce aluminium metal date back to 1760. The first successful attempt, however, was completed in 1824 by Danish physicist and chemist Hans Christian Ørsted. He reacted anhydrous aluminium chloride with potassium amalgam, yielding a lump of metal looking similar to tin. He presented his results and demonstrated a sample of the new metal in 1825. In 1827, German chemist Friedrich Wöhler repeated Ørsted's experiments but did not identify any aluminium. (The reason for this inconsistency was only discovered in 1921.) He conducted a similar experiment in the same year by mixing anhydrous aluminium chloride with potassium and produced a powder of aluminium. In 1845, he was able to produce small pieces of the metal and described some physical properties of this metal. For many years thereafter, Wöhler was credited as the discoverer of aluminium.
premise: सन् 1754 में मारग्राफ़ (Marggraf) ने यह प्रदर्शित किया कि जिस मिट्टी को ऐल्यूमिना कहा जाता है, वह चूने से भिन्न है। सर हंफ्री डेवी ने सन् 1807 ही में ऐल्यूमिया मिट्टी से धातु पृथक करने का प्रयत्न किया, परंतु सफलता न मिली। सन् 1825 में अर्स्टेड (Oersted) ने ऐल्युमिनियम क्लोराइड को पोटैसियम संरस के साथ गरम किया और फिर आसवन करके पारे को उड़ा दिया। ऐसा करने पर जो चूर्ण सा बच रहा उसमें धातु की चमक (धात्वाभा) थी। सन् 1845 में फ़्रेडरिक वोहलर (Frederik Wohler) ने इस धातु के तैयार करने में पोटैसियम धातु का प्रयोग अपचायक के रूप में किया। उसे इस धातु के कुछ छोटे-छोटे कण मिले, जिनकी परीक्षा करके उसने बताया कि यह नई धातु बहुत हल्की है (आपेक्षिक घनत्व 2.5-2.7) और इसके तार खींचे जा सकते हैं। तदनंतर सोडियम और सोडियम ऐल्यूमिनियम क्लोराइड का प्रयोग करके सन् 1854 में डेविल (Deville) ने इस धातु की अच्छी मात्रा तैयार की। उस समय नई धातु होने के कारण ऐल्यूमिनियम की गिनती बहुमूल्य धातुओं में की जाती थी और इसका उपयोग आभरणों और अलंकारों में होता था। सन् 1886 में ओहायो (अमरीका) नगर में चाल्र्स मार्टिन हॉल ने गले हुए क्रायोलाइट में ऐल्यूमिना घोला और उसमें से विद्युद्विश्लेषण विधि द्वारा ऐल्यूमिनियम धातु पृथक की। यूरोप में भी लगभग इसी वर्ष हेरो (Heroult) ने स्वतंत्र रूप से इसी प्रकार यह धातु तैयार की। यही हॉल-हेरो-विधि आजकल इस धातु के उत्पादन में व्यवहृत हो रही है। हलकी और सस्ती होने के कारण ऐल्यूमिनियम और उससे बनी मिश्र धातुओं का प्रचलन तब से बराबर बढ़ता चला जा रहा है।

title: Aluminium
translation3: In 1754, Marggraf demonstrated that the clay called alumina was different from lime. Sir Humphrey Davy tried to separate metal from alumia clay in 1807, but did not succeed. In 1825, Oersted heated aluminum chloride with potassium solution and then distilled the mercury. After doing this, the powder that remained had the metallic luster (metallic luster). In 1845, Frederick Wohler used potassium metal as a reducing agent in the preparation of this metal. He found some small particles of this metal, after examining which he said that this new metal is very light (relative density 2.5-2.7) and its wires can be drawn. Subsequently, by using sodium and sodium aluminum chloride, Deville prepared a good quantity of this metal in 1854. Being a new metal at that time, aluminum was counted among the precious metals and was used in ornaments and ornaments. In 1886, Charles Martin Hall in Ohio (America) city dissolved aluminum in melted cryolite and isolated aluminum metal from it by electrolysis. In Europe too, around the same year, Heroult independently prepared this metal in a similar manner. The same Hall-Herro method is being used nowadays in the production of this metal. Due to being light and cheap, the popularity of aluminum and its alloys has been increasing since then.

text: One of the challenges of string theory is that the full theory does not have a satisfactory definition in all circumstances. Another issue is that the theory is thought to describe an enormous landscape of possible universes, which has complicated efforts to develop theories of particle physics based on string theory. These issues have led some in the community to criticize these approaches to physics, and to question the value of continued research on string theory unification.

text: The characteristic measles rash is classically described as a generalized red maculopapular rash that begins several days after the fever starts. It starts on the back of the ears and, after a few hours, spreads to the head and neck before spreading to cover most of the body, often causing itching. The measles rash appears two to four days after the initial symptoms and lasts for up to eight days. The rash is said to "stain", changing color from red to dark brown, before disappearing. Overall, measles usually resolves after about three weeks.

text: The basic civil and criminal laws governing the citizens of India are set down in major parliamentary legislation, such as the civil procedure code, the penal code, and the criminal procedure code. Similar to the Union government, individual state governments each consist of executive, legislative and judiciary branches. The legal system as applicable to the Union and individual state governments is based on the English common and statutory law. The full name of the country is the Republic of India. India and Bharat are equally official short names for the Republic of India in the Constitution, and both names appears on legal banknotes, in treaties and in legal cases. The terms "Union government", "central government" and "" are often used officially and unofficially to refer to the government of India. The term New Delhi is commonly used as a metonym for the Union government, as the seat of the central government is in New Delhi.

title: Government of India
translation3: The basic civil and criminal laws relating to the citizens of India such as the Code of Civil Procedure, Indian Penal Code, Code of Criminal Procedure, etc. are mainly made by the Parliament. The Union and every state government works under three organs: executive, legislature and judiciary. The legal system applicable to the federal and state governments is based primarily on English Common and Statutory Law. India accepts the jurisdiction of the International Court of Justice with some exceptions. Governance has been decentralized at the local level through the Panchayati Raj system.

text: There are three generalized categories in which amnesia could be acquired by a person. The three categories are head trauma (example: head injuries), traumatic events (example: seeing something devastating to the mind), or physical deficiencies (example: atrophy of the hippocampus). The majority of amnesia and related memory issues derive from the first two categories as these are more common and the third could be considered a subcategory of the first.

text: Old English is one of the West Germanic languages, and its closest relatives are Old Frisian and Old Saxon. Like other old Germanic languages, it is very different from Modern English and Modern Scots, and largely incomprehensible for Modern English or Modern Scots speakers without study. Within Old English grammar nouns, adjectives, pronouns and verbs have many inflectional endings and forms, and word order is much freer. The oldest Old English inscriptions were written using a runic system, but from about the 8th century this was replaced by a version of the Latin alphabet.

text: Behaviorism developed in the 1920s, and behavior modification as a therapy became popularized in the 1950s and 1960s. Notable contributors were Joseph Wolpe in South Africa, M.B. Shapiro and Hans Eysenck in Britain, and John B. Watson and B.F. Skinner in the United States. Behavioral therapy approaches relied on principles of operant conditioning, classical conditioning and social learning theory to bring about therapeutic change in observable symptoms. The approach became commonly used for phobias, as well as other disorders.

text: Pregnancy at an early age decreases the risk of developing breast cancer later in life. The risk of breast cancer also declines with the number of children a woman has. Breast cancer then becomes more common in the 5 or 10 years following pregnancy but then becomes less common than among the general population. These cancers are known as postpartum breast cancer and have worse outcomes including an increased risk of distant spread of disease and mortality. Other cancers found during or shortly after pregnancy appear at approximately the same rate as other cancers in women of a similar age.
premise: स्तन रोग कैंसरमुक्त (हलके) या कैंसर सम्बन्धी(घातक) होते हैं। अधिकांश स्तन रोग कैंसरमुक्त होते हैं, जिनके होने से जीवन पर कोई खतरा नहीं होता और उन्हें उपचार की आवश्यकता नहीं होती है। परन्तु स्तन कैंसर का मतलब स्तन या जीवन का नुकसान होता है। इसी कारण से महिलाओं में स्तन कैंसर उनके जीवन पर सबसे बड़ा खतरा है। स्तन रोगों को या तो प्रजनन प्रणाली के विकार, या प्रजनन के विकारों के साथ वर्गीकृत किया जा सकता है। " " स्तन रोगों के कई प्रकार होते हैं, वे संक्रमण के साथ या बिना संक्रमण के छाती पर गाँठ का कारण बनते हैं।

इसी कारण से महिलाओं में स्तन कैंसर उनके जीवन पर सबसे बड़ा खतरा है। 
This is the reason why breast cancer is dangerous for women. 

स्तन रोगों को या तो प्रजनन प्रणाली के विकार, या प्रजनन के विकारों के साथ वर्गीकृत किया जा सकता है।
Breast diseases can be classified as reproduction system diseases or reproduction diseases.

स्तन रोगों के कई प्रकार होते हैं, वे संक्रमण के साथ या बिना संक्रमण के छाती पर गाँठ का कारण बनते हैं।
Breast diseases are of various types, they can cause a lump in the chest with or without infection.

title: Breast cancer
translation3: Breast diseases can be noncancerous (mild) or cancerous (fatal). Most breast diseases are non-cancerous, not life threatening and do not require treatment. But breast cancer means loss of the breast or life. For this reason, breast cancer in women is the biggest threat to their lives. Breast diseases can be classified as either disorders of the reproductive system, or disorders of reproduction. " " There are many types of breast diseases, they cause lumps on the chest with or without infection.

text: Photoshop's naming scheme was initially based on version numbers. However, in October 2002 (following the introduction of Creative Suite branding), each new version of Photoshop was designated with "CS" plus a number; e.g., the eighth major version of Photoshop was Photoshop CS and the ninth was Photoshop CS2. Photoshop CS3 through CS6 were also distributed in two different editions: Standard and Extended. With the introduction of the Creative Cloud branding in June 2013 (and in turn, the change of the "CS" suffix to "CC"), Photoshop's licensing scheme was changed to that of software as a service subscription model. Historically, Photoshop was bundled with additional software such as Adobe ImageReady, Adobe Fireworks, Adobe Bridge, Adobe Device Central and Adobe Camera RAW.
premise: फ़ोटोशॉप नामकरण योजना शुरू में संस्करण संख्याओं पर आधारित थी। हालांकि, अक्टूबर 2002 में, क्रिएटिव सूइट ब्रांडिंग के परिचय के बाद, फ़ोटोशॉप के प्रत्येक नए संस्करण को "सीएस" से अधिक संख्या में नामित किया गया; उदा।, फ़ोटोशॉप का आठवां प्रमुख संस्करण Photoshop CS था और नौवां प्रमुख संस्करण Photoshop CS2 था। फ़ोटोशॉप सीएस 3 के माध्यम से CS6 भी दो अलग-अलग संस्करणों में वितरित किए गए: मानक और विस्तारित। जून 2013 में, क्रिएटिव क्लाउड ब्रैंडिंग की शुरुआत के साथ, फ़ोटोशॉप की लाइसेंसिंग योजना को सॉफ्टवेयर के रूप में बदल दिया गया था और एक सर्विस रेटल मॉडल के रूप में "सीएस" प्रत्यय को "सीसी" से बदल दिया गया था। ऐतिहासिक रूप से, फ़ोटोशॉप को अतिरिक्त सॉफ्टवेयर जैसे एडोब इमेजरेडी, एडोब आतिशबाजी, एडोब ब्रिज, एडोब डिवाइस सेंट्रल और एडोब कैमरा रॉ के साथ बंडल किया गया था।
title: Adobe Photoshop
translation3: The Photoshop naming scheme was initially based on version numbers. However, in October 2002, following the introduction of the Creative Suite branding, each new version of Photoshop was designated with a number greater than "CS"; E.g., the eighth major version of Photoshop was Photoshop CS and the ninth major version was Photoshop CS2. Photoshop CS3 through CS6 were also distributed in two different editions: Standard and Extended. In June 2013, with the introduction of the Creative Cloud branding, Photoshop's licensing scheme was changed to a software as a service rental model and the "CS" suffix was replaced with "CC". Historically, Photoshop was bundled with additional software such as Adobe ImageReady, Adobe Fireworks, Adobe Bridge, Adobe Device Central, and Adobe Camera Raw.

text: It is estimated that Europa has an outer layer of water around thick--a part frozen as its crust and a part as a liquid ocean underneath the ice. Recent magnetic-field data from the Galileo orbiter showed that Europa has an induced magnetic field through interaction with Jupiter's, which suggests the presence of a subsurface conductive layer. This layer is likely to be a salty liquid-water ocean. Portions of the crust are estimated to have undergone a rotation of nearly 80°, nearly flipping over (see true polar wander), which would be unlikely if the ice were solidly attached to the mantle. Europa probably contains a metallic iron core.
premise: यूरोपा मुख्य रूप से पत्थरीले पदार्थों का बना हुआ है और इसका केंद्र लोहे का है। इसकी सतह पानी की बर्फ़ की बनी हुई है और पूरे सौर मंडल की सब से समतल सतहों में गिनी जाती है। इस सतह पर दरारें तो नज़र आती हैं लेकिन प्रहार क्रेटर बहुत कम हैं। दरारों में भी नई बर्फ़ से भरी हुई लगतीं हैं। सतह को देख कर बहुत से वैज्ञानिकों को लगता है के उसके नीचे ज़रूर एक पानी का समुद्र होगा। उनकी सोच है के जब भी सतह किसी उल्कापिंड के गिरने से फटती है या उसमें बृहस्पति के ज्वारभाटा बल की खींचातानी से दरारें पड़ती हैं, तो नीचे से सागर के पानी से सम्पर्क रखने वाली गर्म बर्फ़ ऊपर आ जाती है और सख़्ती से जमकर घाव भर देता है। अगर वास्तव में ऐसा समुद्र है तो सम्भव है के उसमें जीवन पनप रहा हो। इस सम्भावना की वजह से यूरोप और अमेरिका की अंतरिक्ष क्षोध एजेंसियाँ यूरोपा पर और अनुसंधान करने की योजनाएँ बना रही हैं। वैज्ञानिक यह भी अनुमान लगते हैं के यूरोपा की सख़्त बर्फ़ीली सतह अरबों साल पहले हुए अपने निर्माण के बाद 80° घूम चुकी है। इस से यह शंका और तीव्र होती है की सतही बर्फ़ का खोल एक पानी के गोले के ऊपर तैर रहा है और आराम से हिल-डुल सकता है। अन्य वैज्ञानिकों का कहना है के ऐसा कोई समुद्र नहीं है और बाहर की सख़्त बर्फ़ के नीचे केवल नरम बर्फ़ है - लेकिन ऐसा विश्वास रखने वाले वैज्ञानिक अल्प संख्या में हैं।

annotations.comment:
यूरोपा मुख्य रूप से पत्थरीले पदार्थों का बना हुआ है और इसका केंद्र लोहे का है। 
Europa is composed mainly of rocky material and has an iron core.
इसकी सतह पानी की बर्फ़ की बनी हुई है और पूरे सौर मंडल की सब से समतल सतहों में गिनी जाती है। 
Its surface is made of water ice and is counted among the most flat surfaces of the entire solar system.
इस सतह पर दरारें तो नज़र आती हैं लेकिन प्रहार क्रेटर बहुत कम हैं। दरारों में भी नई बर्फ़ से भरी हुई लगतीं हैं। 
Cracks are visible on this surface but impact craters are very few. Even the cracks seem to be filled with new snow.
सतह को देख कर बहुत से वैज्ञानिकों को लगता है के उसके नीचे ज़रूर एक पानी का समुद्र होगा।
Looking at the surface, many scientists think that there must be a sea of water beneath it.
 उनकी सोच है के जब भी सतह किसी उल्कापिंड के गिरने से फटती है या उसमें बृहस्पति के ज्वारभाटा बल की खींचातानी से दरारें पड़ती हैं, तो नीचे से सागर के पानी से सम्पर्क रखने वाली गर्म बर्फ़ ऊपर आ जाती है और सख़्ती से जमकर घाव भर देता है। 
They think that whenever the surface is cracked by the fall of a meteorite or cracks in it by the pull of Jupiter's tidal force, the hot ice that contacts the ocean water from below comes up and hardens and heals the wound.
अगर वास्तव में ऐसा समुद्र है तो सम्भव है के उसमें जीवन पनप रहा हो। 
If there really is such an ocean, then it is possible that life is flourishing in it.
इस सम्भावना की वजह से यूरोप और अमेरिका की अंतरिक्ष क्षोध एजेंसियाँ यूरोपा पर और अनुसंधान करने की योजनाएँ बना रही हैं।
Because of this possibility, the space research agencies of Europe and America are making plans to do more research on Europa.
 वैज्ञानिक यह भी अनुमान लगते हैं के यूरोपा की सख़्त बर्फ़ीली सतह अरबों साल पहले हुए अपने निर्माण के बाद 80° घूम चुकी है।
Scientists also speculate that Europa's hard icy surface has rotated 80° since its formation billions of years ago.
 इस से यह शंका और तीव्र होती है की सतही बर्फ़ का खोल एक पानी के गोले के ऊपर तैर रहा है और आराम से हिल-डुल सकता है। 
This leads to the suspicion that the surface ice shell is floating on top of a water sphere and can move freely.
अन्य वैज्ञानिकों का कहना है के ऐसा कोई समुद्र नहीं है और बाहर की सख़्त बर्फ़ के नीचे केवल नरम बर्फ़ है - लेकिन ऐसा विश्वास रखने वाले वैज्ञानिक अल्प संख्या में हैं।
Other scientists say that there is no such ocean and that there is only soft ice beneath the hard outer ice - but there are a small number of scientists who believe this.

title: Europa (moon)
translation3: Europa is mainly made of rocky materials and its center is iron. Its surface is made of water ice and is counted among the flattest surfaces in the entire solar system. Cracks are visible on this surface but there are very few impact craters. Even the cracks seem to be filled with new snow. Looking at the surface, many scientists think that there must be an ocean of water beneath it. Their theory is that whenever the surface cracks due to the fall of a meteorite or cracks due to the pull of Jupiter's tidal force, hot ice in contact with the ocean water from below comes up and hardens and heals the wound. Is. If such an ocean really exists then it is possible that life is thriving in it. Because of this possibility, space research agencies of Europe and America are making plans to conduct further research on Europa. Scientists also estimate that Europa's hard icy surface has rotated 80° since its formation billions of years ago. This further strengthens the suspicion that the surface ice shell is floating on a sphere of water and can move freely. Other scientists say that there is no such ocean and that there is only soft ice beneath the hard ice outside - but scientists who believe this are in the minority.

text: Militarism is the belief or the desire of a government or a people that a state should maintain a strong military capability and to use it aggressively to expand national interests and/or values. It may also imply the glorification of the military and of the ideals of a professional military class and the "predominance of the armed forces in the administration or policy of the state" (see also: stratocracy and military junta).
premise: सैन्यवाद (Militarism) किसी देश की सरकार या जनता की वह दर्शन है जो विश्वास करता है कि उनके देश को एक शक्तिशाली सेना बनानी एवं रखनी चाहिये तथा अपने देश के हितों की सुरक्षा करने एवं उनके संवर्धन के लिये इसका जमकर उपयोग करना चाहिये।

Militarism is the philosophy of a country's government or people who believe that their country should build and maintain a powerful army and use it fiercely to protect and promote their country's interests.

title: Militarism
translation3: Militarism is the philosophy of a country's government or people who believe that their country should create and maintain a powerful military and use it extensively to protect and promote their country's interests.

text: To become a Muslim and to convert to Islam, it is essential to utter the Shahada, one of the Five Pillars of Islam, a declaration of faith and trust that professes that there is only one God (Allah) and that Muhammad is God's messenger. It is a set statement normally recited in Arabic: ašhadu ʾal-lā ʾilāha ʾillā-llāhu wa ʾašhadu ʾanna muħammadan rasūlu-llāh () "I testify that there is no god [worthy of worship] except Allah, and Muhammad is the messenger of Allah."
premise: मुसलमान यह स्वीकार करते हैं कि अल्लाह अकेला परवरदिगार है और हज़रत मुहम्मद (स) अल्लाह के प्रेषित (रसूल) हैं। इस तरीके से कोई भी व्यक्ति इस्लाम में जाता है। जब हज़रत मोहम्मद(स) को अल्लाह का रसूल मान ले तो उस पर वाजिब हो जाता है कि उनकी हर बात पर विश्वास रखे और अमल करने की कोशिश करे। जैसे उन्होंने कहा कि मेरे बाद कोई नबी नहीं और वे परमेश्वर के अन्तिम रसूल हैं तो इस बात पर विश्वास रखना इस्लाम के एकाधिकार में है। इस्लाम के मुख्य धर्म जिन पर मुसलमानों के किसी समुदाय में कोई मतभेद नहीं, निम्नलिखित हैं
title: Muslims
translation3: Muslims accept that Allah is the only God and Hazrat Muhammad (S) is the Messenger (Rasool) of Allah. In this way any person converts to Islam. When one accepts Hazrat Mohammad (S) as the Messenger of Allah, it becomes obligatory on him to believe in everything he says and try to implement it. Like he said that there is no prophet after me and he is the last messenger of God, then it is the monopoly of Islam to believe in this.
